column4: Can anyone tell me how to apply a 'patch' to a c file for OpenSSH? The link to the patch is http://bugzilla.mindrot.org/attachment.cgi?id=1171
Im not sure how to apply a patch to a program that I got via apt-get
patch -pAPPROPRIATE_NUMBER_HERE < file.patch,  see man patch for explanation of -p
also, for rebuilding packages http://www.debian.org/doc/manuals/apt-howto/ch-sourcehandling.en.html
So do I need to download the source, apply the patch then make and install?
no, see the last link I gave you
looking at it but it only talks abt apt-get and downloading the source
right, you download the source package, patch it, then rebuild it using the method decribed there
What would be the "appropriate number" part?
depends on how the patch was created.  Usually -p0 will work find, but see man patch for a good explanation, it's very readable, I promise
Actually I think this 'patch' is just a new pam-auth.c file
Wouldnt I just replace that file in the sorce befor compiling
I guess
Are you still here?
find
what is the %user variable?
you would create a symlink with a relative path, not an absolute one
I dontunderstand exactly
like  ln -s .. this_is_a_symlink
Ah I see
if it is in a subdirectory of /home/username, yes
